Patent Information.Patent Title: Antimicrobial peptides of the family of defensins, polynucleotides encoding said peptides, transformed vectors and organisms containing them.
Patent Information.Abstract: The invention concerns novel antimicrobial peptides of the family of defensins, in particular antifungal, called termicines, polynucleotides encoding said peptides, vectors containing them for transforming a host organism and the method for transforming said organism. The invention also concerns transformed organisms, in particular yeast producing termicine, or plant cells and plants, the termicines produced by the transformed plats providing them with resistence to fungus-mediated diseases. The invention further concerns the use of termicines as medicine and pharmaceutical compositions containing them.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus megaterium, Micrococcus luteus, Streptococcus pyogenes(++).Fungi:Fusarium culmorum, Fusarium oxysporum, Neurospora crassa, Nectria haematococca, Trichoderma viride(+); Candida albicans, Cryptococcus neoformans, Saccharomyces cerevisiae(+++).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry

Literature.Title: Insect immunity. Constitutive expression of a cysteine-rich antifungal and a linear antibacterial peptide in a termite insect.
Literature.Author: Lamberty M, Zachary D, Lanot R, Bordereau C, Robert A, Hoffmann JA, Bulet P.
